It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, hairy structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky substrates or in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Amauropelta dudleyi is considered a species of conservation concern.
